case_vignette: A 20-year-old college student comes to the physician because she has been extremely sad for the past 3 weeks and has to cry constantly. Three weeks ago, her boyfriend left her after they were together for 4 years. She has no appetite and has had a 2.3-kg (5.1-lb) weight loss. She has missed several classes because she could not stop crying or get out of bed. She thinks about her ex-boyfriend all the time. She says that she experienced similar symptoms for about 2 months after previous relationships ended. The patient is 158 cm (5 ft 2 in) tall and weighs 45 kg (100 lb); BMI is 18 kg/m2. Her temperature is 36.1°C (97°F), pulse is 65/min, and blood pressure is 110/60 mm Hg. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. On mental status examination she appears sad and cries easily.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. I have been extremely sad, crying constantly, and have lost my appetite leading to weight loss.

Yes, my boyfriend left me three weeks ago after we were together for 4 years.

I did not mention any changes to my sleeping patterns in the information I provided.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder
